commentary.comment: The first half of this match is about to start.
It's a goal! Coke plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Iborra (Sevilla). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 1:0.

Javier Flores Santacruz (Elche) latches on to a precise lofted cross inside the box, controls the ball and drills a fine strike towards the middle of the goal. His dangerous effort is blocked by Javi Varas, who makes a glorious save!
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Antonio Cotan (Sevilla) was quite harsh and Alejandro Hernandez didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The match has reached half-time.
Alejandro Hernandez blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Jairo Samperio (Sevilla) strikes the rebound, but it goes well over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Elche will have a goal kick.
Goal! Jairo Samperio (Sevilla) with a wonderful piece of finishing. He makes a yard for himself after a well-taken pass inside the box and strikes the ball into the bottom left corner.
Substitution. Garry Rodrigues (Elche) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Javier Marquez walks off.

Carlos Fernandez (Sevilla) meets a cross inside the penalty area and unloads a good attempt towards the bottom right corner. Manu Herrera is prepared, though, and denies him with a fantastic save. Sevilla have been awarded a corner kick.
Goal! Jose Antonio Reyes plays a pass to the feet of Iborra (Sevilla), and he shoots into the bottom left corner from inside the box. It's 3:0.
Jose Antonio Reyes comes off the pitch to be replaced by Ivan Rakitic (Sevilla).
Here comes a substitution. Tired Javi Flores (Elche) left the pitch, and Richmond Boakye (Elche) is coming on to help his team.
Iborra (Sevilla) has tested the patience of referee Alejandro Hernandez and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
It is time for a substitution. Israel Puerto (Sevilla) is on for Federico Fazio.
The referee signals a substitution. Samu (Elche) is brought on as a substitute for Fidel Fidel.
Substitution. Totally exhausted Alberto Moreno (Sevilla) is leaving the pitch, and Moi (Sevilla) will replace him.
Goal! Richmond Boakye (Elche) scores after an assist by Garry Rodrigues that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 3:1.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Fran Velez limps off the pitch to be replaced by Ramon Azeez (Almeria).
Javier Estrada Fernandez shows a yellow card to Erik Moran (Ath Bilbao) for a tough tackle.
Benat (Ath Bilbao) has tested the patience of referee Javier Estrada Fernandez and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Mikel Balenziaga (Ath Bilbao) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.

Aymeric Laporte (Ath Bilbao) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner but his effort goes narrowly wide of the left post. This should be a big warning for the defence. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Almeria.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Javier Estrada Fernandez has ended it.
Referee Javier Estrada Fernandez blows his whistle to start the second half.
Aymeric Laporte (Ath Bilbao) goes into the referee's book for dissent.
Mikel Rico goes off the pitch and Ander Herrera (Ath Bilbao) comes on.

Aleix Vidal (Almeria) receives a lofted pass and is given time inside the box to unleash a shot goalwards. The ball is directed to the bottom left corner, but it lacks power and Iago Herrerin pulls off a comfortable save to thwart the effort. Corner kick. Almeria will have an opportunity.
A substitution has been made. Aymeric Laporte goes off and Mikel San Jose (Ath Bilbao) comes on.
Substitution. Andoni Iraola (Ath Bilbao) in, Mikel Balenziaga out.
It will be a substitution. Rodri (Almeria) is ready to enter the pitch as Oscar Diaz walks off.
Ramon Azeez (Almeria) is penalised.
Substitution. Corona is replaced by Fernando Soriano (Almeria).

Rodri (Almeria) meets a cross inside the penalty area and unloads a good attempt towards the bottom right corner. Iago Herrerin is prepared, though, and denies him with a fantastic save. Almeria have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.

Golden chance! Rodri (Almeria) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Ath Bilbao will have a goal kick.
Guillermo (Ath Bilbao) makes a good run inside the box to meet a precise cross. He latches on to it and shoots, but the goalkeeper pulls off an excellent save.
He has been shown a yellow card.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Oriol Riera (Osasuna) blows a huge opportunity! He latches on to a perfect cross from the wing into the penalty area, but sends a bullet header just wide of the left post!
It's in the back of the net! Alvaro Cejudo picks out Oriol Riera (Osasuna) with a sweet pass, and he latches on to it deep inside the box and beats the goalkeeper. 1:0.
Substitution. Damien Perquis is replaced by Lorenzo Reyes (Betis).

Roberto Torres (Osasuna) bursts into the box and pulls the trigger, but he can't beat the goalkeeper. He directed his daisy-cutter towards the left post, but one of the defenders reacted brilliantly to block it.
Goal! Carlos Acuna (Osasuna) gathered the ball off a rebound inside the box and fired home into the right side of the net.
Alejandro Arribas (Osasuna) blows a huge opportunity! He latches on to a perfect cross from the wing into the penalty area, but sends a bullet header narrowly over the crossbar!
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Juan Martinez Munuera has ended it.
The whistle blows and Juan Martinez Munuera starts the second half.

Ruben Castro (Betis) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the top right corner is blocked by Andres Fernandez, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. Betis win a corner.

Francisco Chica (Betis) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Andres Fernandez makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the left side of the goal.
Substitution. Javier Matilla makes his way off the pitch and Fuentes Pibe (Betis) comes on as his replacement.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Alvaro Cejudo (Osasuna) leaves the pitch and  comes on.
Nosa Igiebor (Betis) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Cedrick.
It's time for a substitution. Nino (Osasuna) comes on in place of Roberto Torres.
Francisco Chica (Betis) collects a good pass and slams the ball from mid-range into the top right corner, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
Substitution.  Damia (Osasuna) has come on for Joan Oriol.
Francisco Punal (Osasuna) earns the yellow card.

Ruben Castro (Betis) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the bottom right corner. Andres Fernandez pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. The ball is out of play. Betis will have a chance to score from a corner.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.
A substitution has been made. Juan Rodriguez is replaced by Borja (Getafe).
Mehdi Lacen (Getafe) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Jesus Gil Manzano didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Jesus Gil Manzano shows a yellow card to Lisandro Lopez (Getafe) for a tough tackle.
A yellow card for a tackle by Leonel Galeano (Rayo Vallecano). Jesus Gil Manzano doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
What a huge chance for Angel Lafita (Getafe). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Rafa (Getafe) sees a yellow card from Jesus Gil Manzano after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Goal! Ciprian Marica (Getafe) collects a pass and without hesitation fires an unstoppable shot into the bottom right corner.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Referee Jesus Gil Manzano blows his whistle to start the second half.
It's time for a substitution. Ruben Rochina (Rayo Vallecano) comes on in place of .
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Tito leaves the pitch and Sebastian Bruno Fernandez Miglierina (Rayo Vallecano) comes on.
The foul by Alexis (Getafe) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Jesus Gil Manzano.
David Cobeno (Rayo Vallecano) receives a yellow card.
Juan Valera (Getafe) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Jesus Gil Manzano ignores the protests.
Alberto Perea (Rayo Vallecano) comes off the pitch to be replaced by .
Substitution. Angel Lafita walks off the pitch and Pedro Mosquera Parada (Getafe) comes on as a substitute.
Roberto Trashorras (Rayo Vallecano) can showcase his brilliant free kick ability, particularly from a distance like this. He hits the ball perfectly and it ends up inside the right post.
Jesus Gil Manzano shows a yellow card to Pedro Mosquera Parada (Getafe), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.

Close! Ciprian Marica (Getafe) is a whisker away from finishing-off the move he started. His close-range effort flies just over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Rayo Vallecano.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Sammir (Getafe) will replace Pedro Leon.
A goal, which was scored by Bueno (Rayo Vallecano), was disallowed due to offside.
Jesus Gil Manzano has issued a yellow card to Pedro Leon (Getafe).
Roberto Trashorras (Rayo Vallecano) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.

Today's referee Jesus Gil Manzano rightly decides to book Ruben (Rayo Vallecano) for his harsh tackle. The referee makes a quick call and points to the penalty spot. Big scoring opportunity for Getafe.
Ciprian Marica (Getafe) steps up and confidently powers his spot-kick into the bottom right corner.
The match has just finished.
Carlos Clos Gomez checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.

Javi Guerra (Valladolid) and his stunning dribble! He zig-zags through the defence and gets in front of the keeper. He faints to shoot and then suddenly strikes goalwards, but his effort misses the target by a whisker. Very unlucky for Javi Guerra (Valladolid). This could have been a legendary goal. The ball goes out of play and Granada CF will have a goal kick.
Jeffren (Valladolid) receives a pass and tries his luck with a shot from 22 metres out. Roberto Fernandez pulls off a decent save to stop the effort going in the top left corner.
This is definitely not what Stefan Mitrović (Valladolid) wanted. Attempting to intercept an offensive pass, he scored an own goal and made it 0:1.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Carlos Clos Gomez blows his whistle to start the second half.
Substitution. Manucho (Valladolid) in, Jeffren out.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Humberto Osorio (Valladolid) comes onto the pitch for Daniel Larsson.
Piti (Granada CF) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Dimitri Foulquier (Granada CF) comes onto the pitch because Piti simply cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.

Roberto Fernandez hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Javi Guerra (Valladolid) shoots from the edge of the box towards the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save. Valladolid have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
Roberto Fernandez (Granada CF) is the one who receives a yellow card.
Substitution. Odion Ighalo (Granada CF) on for Youseff El Arabi.
Oscar Gonzalez (Valladolid) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.

Yacine Brahimi (Granada CF) bursts inside the box, beats two defenders and produces a strike from the penalty spot. The shot has power, but lacks precision and the goalkeeper stops it easily. The scoreline remains the same.
That will be all from Alvaro Rubio who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Javier Baraja (Valladolid).
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Yacine Brahimi as he is replaced by Alexandre Coeff (Granada CF).

Odion Ighalo (Granada CF) runs with the ball towards the keeper and pulls the trigger from close range, but Jaime anticipates his intention and makes an amazing save to stop the shot going into the right side of the target. Granada CF have been awarded a corner kick.
That's the end of the match.
Referee Carlos Velasco blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.

Claudio Bravo pulls off a great save to deny Giovani dos Santos (Villarreal) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far!

Giovani dos Santos (Villarreal) scores with a great individual effort! He makes a good run, skips past defenders and fires the ball from the edge of the box past the diving goalkeeper. His low drive went into the bottom left corner. Absolutely phenomenal!
The booking goes to Bojan Jokic (Villarreal).
Markel Bergara (Real Sociedad) spurned a good chance! He gets a shot away from inside the penalty box, but it goes inches wide of the right post.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Carlos Velasco has ended it.
Carlos Velasco blows his whistle and the second half starts.
The game has come to an end for Ruben Pardo. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of David Zurutuza (Real Sociedad).
Substitution. Esteban Granero (Real Sociedad) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Imanol Agirretxe walks off.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Tomas Pina (Villarreal) will replace Bruno.

What a save from Juan Carlos! Antoine Griezmann (Real Sociedad) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range towards the left post, but the goalkeeper has pulled off a brilliant stop to keep it out.
The substitution is prepared. Jaume Costa (Villarreal) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Javier Aquino.
A yellow card for a tackle by Mateo Musacchio (Villarreal). Carlos Velasco doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision. Real Sociedad are awarded a free kick.
It's a yellow card for Markel Bergara (Real Sociedad).

Giovani dos Santos produces a sweet pass and picks out Ikechukwu Uche (Villarreal) inside the box. He quickly takes a shot which goes into the middle of the net and leaves the goalkeeper helpless. He makes it 0:1!
The referee allows time for a substitution. Carlos Martinez will be replaced by Chory Castro (Real Sociedad).
Here comes a substitution. Giovani dos Santos is given a rest as he is replaced by Jonathan Pereira (Villarreal).
Caution goes to Esteban Granero (Real Sociedad).
Carlos Velasco shows a yellow card to  for a tough tackle.
Goal! Carlos Vela (Real Sociedad) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from David Zurutuza, then sends the ball into the bottom right corner. 1:2.
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.
Goal! Jonny puts the ball on a plate for Inigo Lopez (Celta Vigo), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 0:1.

Jonas (Valencia) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the bottom right corner is blocked by Sergio Alvarez, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. Valencia have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.

Michel (Valencia) collects a rebound and produces a mid-range attempt. The ball goes towards the roof of the net, but Sergio Alvarez keeps it out with an amazing save. Valencia have been awarded a corner kick.
Sergio Alvarez blocks a long-range effort from Michel (Valencia) towards the right side of the goal. The ball goes out of play. Valencia are awarded a corner kick.
Joao Pereira (Valencia) sees a yellow card from Carlos Del Cerro after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Jon Aurtenetxe (Celta Vigo) receives a yellow card for infringement.

It's a goal! Sofiane Feghouli (Valencia) makes it 0:1. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Pablo Piatti and planted his close-range header low into the middle of the goal. Sergio Alvarez was helpless.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Carlos Del Cerro has ended it.
The whistle blows and Carlos Del Cerro starts the second half.
Carlos Del Cerro shows a yellow card to Alex Lopez (Celta Vigo), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.

It's a goal! Pablo Piatti (Valencia) makes it 1:1. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Sofiane Feghouli and planted his close-range header into the left side of the goal. Sergio Alvarez was helpless.
The referee signals a substitution. Michael Krohn-Dehli (Celta Vigo) is brought on as a substitute for Alex Lopez.
Here comes a substitution. Tired Santi Mina (Celta Vigo) left the pitch, and Mario Bermejo (Celta Vigo) is coming on to help his team.
Substitution. Eduardo Vargas will be replaced by Alcacer Paco (Valencia).
It's time for a substitution. David Costas (Celta Vigo) comes on in place of Inigo Lopez.
Nolito (Celta Vigo) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Carlos Del Cerro didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Pablo Piatti (Valencia) misses a chance to score! He produces a header from inside the box, but it goes narrowly over the crossbar.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Jonas will be replaced by Antonio Barragan (Valencia).
The game has come to an end for Sofiane Feghouli. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Vinicius Araujo (Valencia).
That's the end of the match.
The first half has started.
Gerard Pique (Barcelona) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Diego Costa is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Adrian (Atl. Madrid).
Raul Garcia (Atl. Madrid) comes onto the pitch because Arda Turan simply cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
Goal - 1:0! Lionel Messi laid the ball off to Alexis Sanchez (Barcelona), who shot from close range into the top right corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Diego Godin (Atl. Madrid) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Antonio Mateu Lahoz ignores the protests.
A yellow card for a tackle by Tiago (Atl. Madrid). Antonio Mateu Lahoz doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Sergio Busquets (Barcelona) infringed the rules and goes into the book. Antonio Mateu Lahoz pulls out a yellow card.
Yellow card! It's like Lionel Messi (Barcelona) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Antonio Mateu Lahoz agrees and books him.
Referee Antonio Mateu Lahoz blows his whistle to start the second half.

OFF THE POST! David Villa (Atl. Madrid) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Goal! Gabi launched the corner kick and superbly found the head of Diego Godin (Atl. Madrid), whose accurate effort from near the penalty spot went straight into the bottom right corner. It's 1:1.
Sergio Busquets (Barcelona) is leaving the pitch due to injury. Alex Song (Barcelona) will take his place on the pitch.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Pedro trots off the pitch and is replaced by Neymar (Barcelona).
Lionel Messi (Barcelona) has a goal ruled out for offside!
The foul by Filipe Luis (Atl. Madrid) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Antonio Mateu Lahoz. Barcelona have a free kick from a promising distance.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Adrian walks off the pitch to be replaced by Jose Sosa (Atl. Madrid).
Alex Song (Barcelona) picked up a yellow card from referee.
Cesc Fabregas comes off the pitch to be replaced by Xavi (Barcelona).
Antonio Mateu Lahoz shows the yellow card to Javier Mascherano (Barcelona) for a heavy challenge.
Antonio Mateu Lahoz shows a yellow card to Raul Garcia (Atl. Madrid) for a tough tackle.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.
Marcelo swings the cross over. Karim Benzema (Real Madrid) gets his head to it but it goes just over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Espanyol.

Sergio Ramos (Real Madrid) misses a big chance from point-blank range as he struck the ball towards the bottom right corner. His promising effort following the corner kick was, to his disappointment, thwarted by Francisco Casilla with a fabulous save.

Karim Benzema (Real Madrid) goes on a mazy run through the defence and gets within shooting range inside the box, but his effort to the middle of the target is thwarted by Francisco Casilla. Real Madrid have been awarded a corner kick.
The match has reached half-time.
The whistle blows and David Fernandez Borbalan starts the second half.
The manager has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Alvaro Arbeloa (Real Madrid) replacing Daniel Carvajal (Real Madrid).
Wasted opportunity. Angel Di Maria (Real Madrid) gets to the rebound inside the box and smashes the ball just wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Espanyol.
We are about to witness a subsitution. John Cordoba (Espanyol) for Abraham.
That will be all from Sami Khedira who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Luka Modric (Real Madrid).

Karim Benzema looks around to decide who he is going to pass to. He picks out Gareth Bale (Real Madrid), who collects the ball perfectly and unleashes a terrific shot from just outside of the box towards the bottom left corner and it ricochets in off the post. The score is 1:0.
Golden chance! Simao (Espanyol) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post.
The manager makes a subsitution with Alex (Espanyol) coming on for Victor Sanchez.
Karim Benzema (Real Madrid) is leaving the pitch due to injury. Alvaro Morata (Real Madrid) will take his place on the pitch.
Substitution. Pizzi (Espanyol) in, Simao out.
Pizzi (Espanyol) takes the chance to have an effort at goal from inside the box but blazes it just over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Real Madrid will have a goal kick.
Goal! Alvaro Morata (Real Madrid) fires home from very close range after latching on to a pass from Angel Di Maria. The score is 2:0.
Goal! Sergio Garcia plays a pass to the feet of Pizzi (Espanyol), and he shoots into the bottom left corner from inside the box. It's 2:1.
Goal! Angel Di Maria feeds Alvaro Morata (Real Madrid), who taps the ball into an empty net. He makes it 3:1.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Ezequiel Rescaldani (Malaga) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the left post. Keylor Navas pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. The ball is out of play and Malaga manage to earn a corner.

Keylor Navas was forced into action to thwart Nordin Amrabat (Malaga). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom right corner but couldn't beat the keeper.
Prieto Iglesias shows a yellow card to  for his blatant foul.
Keylor Navas makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the roof of the net by Ezequiel Rescaldani (Malaga) after a cross from the side.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Prieto Iglesias has ended it.
Referee Eduardo Prieto blows his whistle to start the second half.
Substitution. David Barral walks off the pitch and Angel (Levante) comes on as a substitute.
A goal, which was scored by Angel (Levante), was disallowed due to offside.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by David Navarro (Levante) was quite harsh and Eduardo Prieto didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Pablo Perez (Malaga) sends a direct shot in from a dangerously positioned free kick. The ball sails to the top left corner, but the goalkeeper makes a quick save to deny him.
Francisco Portillo (Malaga) scores a lucky goal from mid-range. Although his low shot was struck towards the middle of the goal, the goalkeeper was unable to reach the ball.
Here comes a substitution. Tired Sergio Pinto (Levante) left the pitch, and Jordi Xumetra (Levante) is coming on to help his team.
The manager has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Nabil El Zhar (Levante) replacing Pedro Rios (Levante).
The substitution has been made. Bartlomiej Pawlowski (Malaga) has replaced .
We are about to witness a substitution. Juanmi (Malaga) is replacing Ezequiel Rescaldani.
is awarded a second yellow by Eduardo Prieto and subsequently dismisses him with a red one.
It's time for a substitution. Jose Manuel Casado (Malaga) comes on in place of Pablo Perez.
A clumsy foul by  Nagore (Levante) and Prieto Iglesias blows his whistle. The referee gives a penalty to Malaga!
Jose Manuel Casado (Malaga) doesn't keep his cool and fails to convert the penalty. He skies the ball way over the bar and into the stands.

Keylor Navas makes a good save! Juanmi (Malaga) easily weaves through the defence and unleashes a shot from long range. His effort is directed under the crossbar, but the goalkeeper is alert and stops it.
That's it for today, Eduardo Prieto has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.
Jose Teixeira shows a yellow card to  Weligton (Malaga) for his blatant foul.
David Villa (Atl. Madrid) controls a cross deep inside the box and hits the crossbar!
Arda Turan (Atl. Madrid) criticises the decision of the referee and immediately receives a yellow card.
Raul Garcia (Atl. Madrid) jumps for a cross and produces a fine header from near the penalty spot, but it goes narrowly wide of the right post.
The main referee, Jose Teixeira, is apparently not going to tolerate any discussions. Marcos Angeleri (Malaga) is given a yellow card for dissent.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Jose Teixeira starts the second half.
Eliseu (Malaga) attempts to discuss the decision with Jose Teixeira, but he soon realises that it's not the right thing to do as he sees the yellow.
David Villa (Atl. Madrid) receives a pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Wilfredo Caballero makes a great save to stop his effort.
A substitution has been made. Koke goes off and Adrian (Atl. Madrid) comes on.
Today's match ends for Raul Garcia who will be replaced by Jose Sosa (Atl. Madrid).
Samuel (Malaga) scores from quite a difficult position as he leaps high to connect with a cross and powers his header low inside the right post. Excellent finish.
Arda Turan goes off the pitch and Diego (Atl. Madrid) comes on.

Wilfredo Caballero was forced into action to thwart David Villa (Atl. Madrid). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the right post but couldn't beat the keeper. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Atl. Madrid.
Toby Alderweireld (Atl. Madrid) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header from close range into the bottom left corner. The score is 1:1.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Ezequiel Rescaldani (Malaga) for Roque Santa Cruz.
Tiago (Atl. Madrid) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Jose Teixeira had an easy-decision to make.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Duda (Malaga) was quite harsh and Jose Teixeira didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The manager has decided to substitute Samuel Garcia (Malaga) and he has been replaced by Juanmi (Malaga).
Gabi (Atl. Madrid) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Marcos Angeleri (Malaga) is sent off! He justly receives a yellow card and it is his second one, a red card must be given. The match ends for him.
The manager makes a subsitution with Bartlomiej Pawlowski (Malaga) coming on for Nordin Amrabat.
Adrian (Atl. Madrid) produces a promising shot towards the top right corner after his wonderful solo run, but Wilfredo Caballero thwarts him. Good work from Atl. Madrid as they win a corner.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.

It's a goal! Javi Guerra (Valladolid) makes it 0:1. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Antonio Rukavina and planted his close-range header into the left side of the goal. Antonio Adan was helpless.
Braian Rodriguez (Betis) uses his strength and awareness to get the better of the defender and coolly scores from the resulting corner kick.
Jeffren (Valladolid) receives a sweet pass inside the box, but his effort on goal is blocked by the defender.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Referee Alfonso Alvarez blows his whistle to start the second half.
Marc Valiente (Valladolid) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Carlos Pena (Valladolid) finds some space inside the box and powers his header past the goalkeeper, giving him no chance.
Ruben Castro produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Jorge Molina (Betis) rises high to head the ball into the middle of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 2:2.

What a huge opportunity! Ruben Castro (Betis) attempts to beat the goalkeeper with a close-range strike towards the middle of the target. The amazing Jaime deserves an ovation from the fans as he pulls off a spectacular save and pushes the ball onto the post.

Well-positioned Filipe Luis (Atl. Madrid) was first to the rebound and fired in a shot towards the left post, but Yoel reacted superbly to keep the ball out. The fans could not believe their eyes. It was a miraculous stop!

The referee allows time for a substitution. Koke will be replaced by Jose Sosa (Atl. Madrid).
David Villa (Atl. Madrid) with a wonderful piece of finishing. He makes a yard for himself after a well-taken pass inside the box and nets into the bottom right corner.
Jose Sosa feeds the ball through to David Villa (Atl. Madrid), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the bottom left corner! The goalkeeper was helpless. 0:0!
Miranda (Atl. Madrid) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Antonio Mateu Lahoz didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

picks up a yellow card for an infringement.

beats a few defenders in the penalty area and drives a low shot towards the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper reacts superbly to make a wonderful save.

Diego Marino (Valladolid) reacts well to deny a long-range free kick from Sergio Sanchez (Malaga). The effort goes to the middle of the goal and the goalkeeper is there to stop it. The assistant referee points towards the corner flag and it's going to be a corner kick.
Daniel Larsson (Valladolid) gets on the end of a long pass that is slotted through the defence and easily sends the ball into the bottom left corner!
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Alberto Undiano Mallenco has ended it.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

Fernando Tissone (Malaga) finds himself with a great opportunity! He unleashes a shot from the edge of the box, which whizzes just wide of the left post! The ball is out of play. The goalkeeper is going to restart the game with a goal kick.

Roque Santa Cruz (Malaga) jumps for a cross in the goal area and produces a fine header which goes narrowly wide of the right post! What a huge opportunity! None of the defensive players touched the ball. It's going to be a goal kick.

OFF THE BAR! Javi Guerra (Valladolid) receives a lofted pass from the side and shoots from around the penalty spot, but the ball crashes against the crossbar.
Today's referee Alberto Undiano Mallenco rightly decides to book Stefan Mitrovic (Valladolid) for his harsh tackle.
We are about to witness a substitution. Flavio Ferreira (Malaga) is replacing Jesus Gamez.

Duda (Malaga) sends a direct shot in from the free kick that's in a promising position. The ball sails towards the underside of the crossbar, but the goalkeeper prevents a goal with a quick save. We are about to witness a corner kick, another promising situation.
Today's match ends for Alvaro Rubio who will be replaced by Marc Valiente (Valladolid).

Javi Guerra (Valladolid) wastes a huge opportunity! He receives a precise cross inside the penalty area and releases a quick shot that sails towards the bottom right corner. His effort, however, lacks power and the goalkeeper dives to make a stunning save. It will be a corner kick for Valladolid.
That's the end of the match.
Referee Alfonso Alvarez blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.

Andoni Iraola produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Aritz Aduriz (Ath Bilbao) rises high to head the ball into the right side of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 1:0.

Markel Susaeta looks around to decide who he is going to pass to. He picks out Aritz Aduriz (Ath Bilbao), who collects the ball perfectly and unleashes a terrific shot from just outside of the box towards the top left corner and it ricochets in off the post. The score is 2:0.
That's the end of the game for Mohammed Fatau, who is replaced by Dimitri Foulquier (Granada CF).
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.

Yacine Brahimi (Granada CF) picks up a yellow card.

Ander Herrera (Ath Bilbao) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the left post is blocked by Roberto Fernandez, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
Riki (Granada CF) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his shot goalwards, but the keeper produces a decent save!

Iker Muniain (Ath Bilbao) misses a rebound from close range. His effort floats narrowly over the crossbar! What a great touch by Ander Herrera (Ath Bilbao) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the centre of the goal, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending.
Markel Susaeta (Ath Bilbao) blew a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross deep inside the box, but his shot flew just over the bar. A goal kick will follow.
Diego Mainz (Granada CF) clearly holds his opponent to prevent him from getting the ball and the referee blows his whistle for a foul.

Diego Mainz (Granada CF) knows that the game is over for him after receiving a red card from the referee for fouling his opponent! The referee gives a penalty to Ath Bilbao after a quick talk with the linesman, who had apparently seen the situation from a better perspective.
Aritz Aduriz (Ath Bilbao) steps up and confidently puts his spot-kick into the middle of the net.
Here comes a substitution.  is given a rest as he is replaced by Richard Boateng (Granada CF).
Today's match ends for Ander Herrera who will be replaced by Oscar de Marcos (Ath Bilbao).
Goal! Carlos Gurpegi (Ath Bilbao) gathered the ball off a rebound inside the box and fired home into the middle of the net.
Oscar de Marcos (Ath Bilbao) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the right post.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Enric Saborit (Ath Bilbao) is coming onto the pitch as Mikel Balenziaga cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Substitution. Guillermo (Ath Bilbao) on for Aritz Aduriz.
Iker Muniain (Ath Bilbao) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.
Iker Muniain (Ath Bilbao) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and fires a quick shot to the left post. His promising effort is kept out by Roberto Fernandez, who pulls off a stunning save!

Simao (Espanyol) wriggles into space inside the box with excellent ball control, but his effort on goal is well blocked.

An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Nahuel Leiva (Villarreal), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the right post.

Giovani dos Santos (Villarreal) wastes a big chance! He unleashes a shot from the edge of the box and it goes narrowly over the crossbar.

The whistle is blown for an infringement and Sergio Asenjo (Villarreal) receives a yellow card!
Gabriel (Villarreal) has received a yellow card for his foul. The referee gives a penalty to Espanyol!
Sergio Garcia (Espanyol) fails to beat the goalkeeper from the penalty spot with a shot inside the left post. Sergio Asenjo anticipates his intention perfectly, though, and leaps to stop his effort.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Alvaro Cejudo (Osasuna) converts a killer cross with a curling shot inside the right post! What a perfect finish!

Emiliano Armenteros (Osasuna) demonstrates how to play football! He collects the ball and decides to go alone. He weaves through the defence and gets to the edge of the box from where he finishes with an effort into the top left corner, deflecting in off the post.

Iker Muniain (Ath Bilbao) smartly converts the penalty. He strikes the ball into the middle of the goal, leaving the goalkeeper stranded.
Mikel Rico (Ath Bilbao) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the left post. The ball goes to play from a goal kick.

Leo Baptistao (Betis) meets a cross inside the box, but he is unable to produce an accurate header and it goes just over the bar. The ball ends up behind the goal line. A goal kick will follow.

The game restarts for the second half.

Excellent touch by Cedrick (Betis)! He latches on to a precise pass deep into the box and unleashes a low drive towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a terrific save. Betis force a corner. They send men into the box.

Salva Sevilla (Betis) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Jesus Gil Manzano ignores the protests. Betis are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.
It is too late to protest. Lorenzo Reyes (Betis) knew very well what he was doing and subsequently receives a second yellow card, ending the match for him.
Here comes a substitution. Nono (Betis) has had enough and is replaced by Nosa Igiebor (Betis).
What a goal-scoring opportunity! Ruben Castro (Betis) finds some space inside the box and gets in a strike, but the shot is brilliantly blocked by one of the defending players sliding in.
A dangerous towering header by Jordi Figueras (Betis) from around the penalty spot goes just wide of the left post. This corner kick didn't change the score. The play will restart with a goal kick.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Javier Matilla (Betis) replaces Cedrick.
Substitution. Mikel Rico makes his way off the pitch and Oscar de Marcos (Ath Bilbao) comes on as his replacement.
Iker Muniain (Ath Bilbao) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.

Guillermo (Ath Bilbao) leaps to meet an excellent cross and steers a fantastic header past the goalkeeper, inside the right post.
Great chance! Sola (Ath Bilbao) collects a great pass inside the box, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.

Markel Susaeta (Ath Bilbao) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Antonio Adan makes a decent save to deny his effort directed to the bottom left corner.

Bueno goes off the pitch and Joaquin Larrivey (Rayo Vallecano) comes on.
A substitution has been made.  goes off and Adrian (Rayo Vallecano) comes on.

Perfectly taken free kick! Ivan Rakitic sends a cross in and Coke (Sevilla) leaps high to connect with it on the edge of the 6-yard box. His close-range header goes into the bottom left corner and the score changes to 0:1.
Saul (Rayo Vallecano) receives a yellow card from the referee, but it seems like a very harsh decision. Ivan Rakitic (Sevilla) takes the ball and sets it for the free kick.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Samuele Longo (Rayo Vallecano) is coming onto the pitch as Razvan Rat cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Diogo Figueiras (Sevilla) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Jairo Samperio.

Ivan Rakitic (Sevilla) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball went a few inches wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play. It's a goal kick.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Kevin Gameiro (Sevilla) will replace Carlos Bacca.
Iborra (Sevilla) is sent-off! After seeing a second yellow and consequently a red card, he must leave the pitch and take an early bath.
Substitution. Ivan Rakitic will be replaced by Piotr Trochowski (Sevilla).
That's all for today as the game is over.
Cesar Muniz Fernandez checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.

Angel Trujillo (Almeria) creates himself some space around the penalty spot and connects with the free kick. His accurate header would probably have ended up in the bottom left corner, but Wilfredo Caballero pulls off a decent save to thwart him. Almeria will take a corner kick.
Fernando Soriano (Almeria) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
Today's referee Cesar Muniz Fernandez rightly decides to book Vitorino Antunes (Malaga) for his harsh tackle. Almeria will take a free kick.
Cesar Muniz Fernandez shows a yellow card to Marcos Angeleri (Malaga), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late. A free kick is awarded to Almeria.
Verza (Almeria) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Jesus Gamez (Malaga) picks up a yellow card for a foul. Almeria have a free kick from a promising distance.

The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

Pablo Perez (Malaga) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.

Angel Trujillo (Almeria) misses the left post by a whisker with a mid-range rebound. What a chance that was! The ball crosses the byline and it's going to be a goal kick.
