The match has just started.

The foul by Sergio Busquets (Barcelona) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by David Fernandez Borbalan. Real Sociedad win a free kick and will be able to apply some pressure on the opposition goal.
Cote (Real Sociedad) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.

What a wonderful moment! David Zurutuza (Real Sociedad) receives a perfect pass in the middle of the pitch, lines up the ball and unloads a powerful strike towards the left post. His effort fails to surprise Victor Valdes, who makes a nice save.
An unfortunate own goal is conceded by Alex Song (Barcelona), who attempted to block the ball after a cross, but instead he sends it into the roof of his own net.
Goal - 1:1! Lionel Messi (Barcelona) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the bottom right corner. Martin Montoya provided an assist for the goal.
David Fernandez Borbalan shows a yellow card to Marc Bartra (Barcelona) for a tough tackle. Real Sociedad win a free kick.

Close! Carlos Vela (Real Sociedad) unleashes a rocket of a shot from the edge of the box and his shot flies just a few inches over the crossbar. A short break for the players as the play will restart with a goal kick.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.

Gerard Pique (Barcelona) sees a yellow card from David Fernandez Borbalan after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground. Free kick. Real Sociedad will probably just try to cross the ball in from here.

Mikel Gonzalez (Real Sociedad) shows good awareness deep inside the box as he latches on to a cross from the resulting free kick. He jumps high but his towering header lacks a little bit of accuracy and flies inches over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play. It's a goal kick.
Goal! Antoine Griezmann (Real Sociedad) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Carlos Vela, then sends the ball into the roof of the net. 2:1.

Alex Song (Barcelona) wins himself just enough space inside the box to connect with the corner. His header flies towards the roof of the net, but the goalkeeper leaps from the ground and makes a stunning save. Barcelona have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.

What an excellent finish! David Zurutuza (Real Sociedad) latched on to an inch-perfect cross into the box and rifled an unstoppable low drive into the middle of the net and past the helpless goalkeeper.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Alex Song trots off the pitch and is replaced by Cesc Fabregas (Barcelona).
Sergio Canales (Real Sociedad) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
The manager has decided to substitute Martin Montoya (Barcelona) and he has been replaced by Alexis Sanchez (Barcelona).
It will be a substitution. Xabi Prieto (Real Sociedad) is ready to enter the pitch as Antoine Griezmann walks off.
Carlos Vela (Real Sociedad) blows a great chance. He unleashes a shot from inside the box, but the effort rattles the left post. The goalkeeper can remain calm.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Ion Ansotegi (Real Sociedad) will replace Sergio Canales.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Gorka Elustondo as he is replaced by Ruben Pardo (Real Sociedad).
That's the end of the match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Borja (Getafe) was quite harsh and Carlos Clos Gomez didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Pedro Leon (Getafe) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes just wide of the left post. Terrific solo effort, though. The ball crosses the byline and it's going to be a goal kick.

Angel Lafita (Getafe) didn't hesitate to slam the ball goalwards after he received a lofted pass from Borja. Yoel probably underestimated his effort, as it went straight into the bottom left corner. The score changes to 0:0.
Alex Lopez (Celta Vigo) receives a yellow card from the referee, but it seems like a very harsh decision.
Jonny (Celta Vigo) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Charles (Celta Vigo) is cautioned and receives a yellow card.
Carlos Clos Gomez shows a yellow card to Lisandro Lopez (Getafe) for his blatant foul.

This should have been a goal! Fabian Orellana (Celta Vigo) takes a mid-range free kick and his effort flies straight as an arrow, but crashes against the crossbar. The keeper only turned his head and stared at the ball. A brief respite for the players as it's a goal kick.
Lisandro Lopez (Getafe) latches on to a lofted pass from the free kick and pulls the trigger from the edge of the box. His effort low towards the middle of the goal is saved by the excellent Yoel.

Fabian Orellana (Celta Vigo) picks up the ball from the resulting corner and immediately unleashes a shot from the edge of the box. The strike has all prerequisites to make it home, but only hits the left post.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Alexis (Getafe).
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
Juan Rodriguez (Getafe) has tested the patience of referee Carlos Clos Gomez and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Lisandro Lopez (Getafe) will not be there to see the end of the game as he is shown a second yellow card instantly followed by red, and the game is over for him.
Substitution. Pablo Sarabia makes his way off the pitch and Rafa (Getafe) comes on as his replacement.

A cross following a corner kick finds its way to Rafinha (Celta Vigo) inside the box and he manages to steer it low to the middle of the target. He is about to start celebrating a goal, but Miguel Angel Moya (Getafe) comes with a save in the nick of time and denies the change of the score.
Substitution. Michael Krohn-Dehli (Celta Vigo) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Borja Oubina walks off.

Rafinha (Celta Vigo) scores with a great individual effort! He makes a good run, skips past defenders and fires the ball from the edge of the box past the diving goalkeeper. His low drive went into the bottom left corner. Absolutely phenomenal!
Rafinha (Celta Vigo) picks up a pass and unleashes a low shot towards goal, but he can't generate enough power to trouble Miguel Angel Moya.

Augusto Fernandez (Celta Vigo) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the right side of the target that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance. The ball goes out of play. Celta Vigo are awarded a corner kick.
That will be all from Borja who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Mehdi Lacen (Getafe).
It will be a substitution. Nolito (Celta Vigo) is ready to enter the pitch as Augusto Fernandez walks off.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Angel Lafita departs the field of play to be replaced by Ciprian Marica (Getafe).
The referee shows the yellow card to Hugo Mallo (Celta Vigo).
Substitution. Santi Mina (Celta Vigo) replaces Charles.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Nolito (Celta Vigo) receives a yellow card!
Juan Valera (Getafe) receives a yellow card.
Nolito (Celta Vigo) accepts a sweet pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a shot towards the goal, but he only hits the left post! What an unlucky moment for him.
Fabian Orellana (Celta Vigo) is shown a yellow card for a late challenge.
Alex Lopez (Celta Vigo) takes a good touch to control a cross on the edge of the box and shoots towards the left post, but one of the defenders reacts brilliantly to block his effort.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Prieto Iglesias checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.

Karim Benzema (Real Madrid) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he unleashed a powerful shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the bottom left corner, but Manu Herrera made a crucial save! Real Madrid force their opponents to concede a corner.

Gareth Bale (Real Madrid) bursts into the box and pulls the trigger, but he can't beat the goalkeeper. He directed his daisy-cutter towards the right post, but one of the defenders reacted brilliantly to block it. Real Madrid force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
Jese (Real Madrid) wastes a big opportunity! He controls the ball after a nice low pass and shoots from a promising distance. His poor effort goes miles wide of the right post.
Brilliant finish! Asier Illarramendi (Real Madrid) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Pepe, then produced a nice strike into the right side of the goal. The score is 1:0.
Alberto Rivera (Elche) sees a yellow card from Eduardo Prieto after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Gareth Bale (Real Madrid) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Gareth Bale (Real Madrid) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Karim Benzema (Real Madrid) receives an accurate pass and finds some space for a shot. The keeper is prepared and denies his low, long-range blast aimed directly at the bottom of the net.
The end of the first half.
The second half has just started.
Javier Marquez (Elche) is flagged for offside.
The referee had an easy-decision to make. A yellow card is given to Alberto Botia (Elche) for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Javier Marquez (Elche) is booked.
Gareth Bale (Real Madrid) produces a wonderful finish! He received a pass from Xabi Alonso and unleashed a fantastic long-range strike into the net off the crossbar. The score is 2:0.
The referee signals a substitution. Aaron Niguez (Elche) is brought on as a substitute for Alberto Rivera.
Here comes a substitution. Fidel Fidel (Elche) is brought on as a substitute for Manuel del Moral Fernandez.
It will be a substitution. Isco (Real Madrid) is ready to enter the pitch as Jese walks off.
Goal! Karim Benzema provides Isco (Real Madrid) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort inside the left post. 3:0.
Substitution. Karim Benzema makes his way off the pitch and Alvaro Morata (Real Madrid) comes on as his replacement.
Substitution. Casemiro (Real Madrid) on for Xabi Alonso.

Alvaro Morata (Real Madrid) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and releases it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Manu Herrera makes a great save to stop his effort.

Alvaro Morata (Real Madrid) and his stunning dribble! He zig-zags through the defence and gets in front of the keeper. He faints to shoot and then suddenly strikes goalwards, but his effort misses the target by a whisker. Very unlucky for Alvaro Morata (Real Madrid). This could have been a legendary goal. Real Madrid have been awarded a corner kick.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
What was Andreas Ivanschitz (Levante) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
David Barral (Levante) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.

Javi Guerra (Valladolid) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the left post. Keylor Navas is alert and denies him with a nice save. The ball is out of play. Goal kick.
The ball is whipped in from the free kick and finds the head of Victor Casadesus (Levante), who rises and produces an amazing header inside the right post.
Valdet Rama (Valladolid) is the one who receives a yellow card.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
The attempt by Valdet Rama is blocked, but from the middle of the box Javi Guerra (Valladolid) hits the rebound into the bottom left corner. He alters the score to 1:1.

Valdet Rama (Valladolid) fires the ball towards goal from just outside the penalty area, but it goes narrowly over the crossbar after coming very close to hitting the roof of the net. A brief respite for the players as it's a goal kick.
Substitution. Pedro Lopez did his best and is replaced by Nabil El Zhar (Levante).
Andreas Ivanschitz goes off the pitch and Ruben Garcia (Levante) comes on.
We are about to witness a substitution. Omar Ramos (Valladolid) is replacing Daniel Larsson. Victor Perez (Valladolid) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Alvaro Rubio.
The referee had an easy-decision to make. A yellow card is given to Stefan Mitrovic (Valladolid) for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Javi Guerra (Valladolid) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy. The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour.  is given a yellow card.
Here's the change. Humberto Osorio leaves the pitch and Manucho (Valladolid) comes on as a substitute.
A substitution has been made. Victor Casadesus goes off and Mohamed Lamine Sissoko Gillan (Levante) comes on.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Excellent touch by Carlos Vela (Real Sociedad)! He latches on to an inch-perfect pass deep into the box and unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper reacts superbly and makes a save.
Carlos Vela (Real Sociedad) scores as he latches on to a pass inside the penalty box and fires a perfect low strike, which goes inside the left post.
This should have been a goal! Nordin Amrabat (Malaga) sends a killer pass into the box, but Mounir El Hamdaoui (Malaga) can't trick the opposition's defence and loses possession.
Ignacio Camacho (Malaga) leaps high deep inside the box to meet a beautiful cross from the free kick and attempts to score with a header. His effort is not accurate at all and goes well over the bar.

Oleksandr Iakovenko (Malaga) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the middle of the goal. Claudio Bravo pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
Vitorino Antunes (Malaga) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
The end of the first half.
Substitution. Francisco Portillo will be replaced by Duda (Malaga).
Referee Carlos Del Cerro blows his whistle to start the second half.
Nordin Amrabat (Malaga) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes just wide of the right post. Terrific solo effort, though.
What a sweet touch by Joseba Zaldua (Real Sociedad) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Wilfredo Caballero to hold.

Haris Seferovic (Real Sociedad) picks up the ball, dribbles to the edge of the penalty area and unleashes a brilliant shot to the roof of the net, but is thwarted by a great save from Wilfredo Caballero.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Samuel (Malaga) comes onto the pitch for Oleksandr Iakovenko.
That's the end of the game for Sergio Canales, who is replaced by Xabi Prieto (Real Sociedad).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and David Zurutuza (Real Sociedad) replaces Haris Seferovic.
Mounir El Hamdaoui comes off the pitch to be replaced by Roque Santa Cruz (Malaga).

Roque Santa Cruz (Malaga)'s poor effort is easily saved by Claudio Bravo. He connects well with a cross, but mistimes it a little, and it heads towards the middle of the target and straight into the grateful hands of the goalkeeper.
Claudio Bravo pulls off a great save to deny Roque Santa Cruz (Malaga), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom right corner.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Ruben Pardo as he is replaced by Gorka Elustondo (Real Sociedad).

Nordin Amrabat (Malaga) received a fine pass and tried his luck from long range. His attempt went towards the top left corner, but Claudio Bravo pulled off a great save to push the ball onto the post. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Malaga will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Unbelievable miss! Antoine Griezmann (Real Sociedad) reacts superbly to latch on to a rebound, but he blazes the ball high over the crossbar!
Flavio Ferreira (Malaga) receives a yellow card.
Roque Santa Cruz (Malaga) is first to the rebound and sends a header goalwards but it's blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition. Corner kick. Malaga will have an opportunity.
Duda (Malaga) is given a fully deserved yellow card.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Referee Alfonso Alvarez blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.

Wow, what an escape. Jose Antonio Reyes (Sevilla) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Sevilla.
Paco Alcacer (Valencia) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the left post. It is going to be a goal kick.
Coke (Sevilla) is given a fully deserved yellow card.
Caution goes to Ricardo Costa (Valencia).
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Alfonso Alvarez blows his whistle to start the second half.
CHANCE! Federico Cartabia (Valencia) picks up a pass inside the box and has a sight of goal, but he blazes his shot well over the top.
That will be a goal kick.
Ricardo Costa (Valencia) receives a yellow card! It's his second one today, which means he will be send off!
The substitute is ready due to the red card. Philippe Senderos (Valencia) comes on to replace Federico Cartabia.
It's a yellow card for Victor Vitolo (Sevilla).
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Jose Antonio Reyes walks off the pitch to be replaced by Denis Cheryshev (Sevilla).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Kevin Gameiro (Sevilla) is coming onto the pitch as Nicolas Pareja cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Alfonso Alvarez shows a yellow card to Juan Bernat (Valencia) for a tough tackle. Sevilla are awarded a penalty!
Philippe Senderos (Valencia) fails to control his temper and is booked by the referee for dissent.

Ivan Rakitic (Sevilla) places the ball on the penalty spot and sends it towards the bottom left corner. His effort isn't powerful enough, allowing Diego Alves to dive and keep the ball out with an excellent save.
Daniel Parejo (Valencia) is cautioned by the referee.

Iborra (Sevilla) displays brilliant awareness inside the six-yard box and leaps high to meet the free kick. He tries to put his header into the middle of the target, but Diego Alves keeps the ball out.
The referee gives a yellow card to Denis Cheryshev (Sevilla).
The manager has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Seydou Keita (Valencia) replacing Alcacer Paco (Valencia).
The game is interrupted. Eduardo Vargas (Valencia) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Daniel Parejo departs the field of play to be replaced by Joao Pereira (Valencia).
A substitution has been made. Iborra is replaced by Sebastian Cristoforo (Sevilla).
Booking. Diego Alves (Valencia) receives a caution from the referee.
A second caution from  for Denis Cheryshev (Sevilla) means that he has to leave the pitch early today. It's a red card.
That's it for today, Alfonso Alvarez has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Sergio Garcia (Espanyol) changes the scoreline after getting on the end of a brilliant pass and firing a precise shot that goes inside the right post!

Christian Stuani (Espanyol) receives a pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Gorka Iraizoz makes a great save to stop his effort. Espanyol have a corner.
Aritz Aduriz (Ath Bilbao) leaps high to meet a lofted pass inside the six-yard box, but his header only flies onto the left post and away off it.

Mikel Rico (Ath Bilbao) latches onto a precise lofted pass into the penalty area and produces a header at goal, but his attempt to the left side of the target fails to beat Francisco Casilla, who makes a sensational save. The ball goes out of play. Ath Bilbao are awarded a corner kick.
Aritz Aduriz (Ath Bilbao) is penalised.
Post! Christian Stuani (Espanyol) latches on to a sweet pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which only hits the right post. What an unlucky moment for him.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Substitution. Erik Moran (Ath Bilbao) in, Aymeric Laporte out.
David Lopez (Espanyol) picks up a yellow card.
Diego Colotto (Espanyol) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
The ball is whipped in from the resulting set piece and finds Carlos Gurpegi (Ath Bilbao), who rises and produces a crashing header low into the middle of the net.
Andoni Iraola (Ath Bilbao) picks up a caution.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Alex (Espanyol) will replace Abraham.
Diego Colotto (Espanyol) receives a cross from the corner kick and sends a shot towards the goal. His effort finds its way behind the helpless goalkeeper and into the bottom left corner.
Here's the change. Ander Herrera leaves the pitch and Oscar de Marcos (Ath Bilbao) comes on as a substitute.
Substitution. Simao did his best and is replaced by Pizzi (Espanyol).

Gorka Iraizoz pulls off a superb save! He leapt to block the shot Christian Stuani (Espanyol) fired on target after a rebound. His effort from inside the box flew straight towards the bottom left corner, but was stopped by the goalkeeper.
Substitution. Markel Susaeta will be replaced by Iker Muniain (Ath Bilbao).
It's like he was asking for a caution. Carlos Gurpegi (Ath Bilbao) receives a yellow card.

Gorka Iraizoz pulls off a great save to deny Christian Stuani (Espanyol) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the underside of the crossbar, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! Espanyol will take a corner kick.
Aritz Aduriz (Ath Bilbao) seems to have forgotten that he has already received a yellow card as he is surprised when the referee shows him a second one!
The manager has decided to introduce fresh legs, with John Cordoba (Espanyol) replacing Sergio Garcia (Espanyol).
That's the end of the match.
The first half has started.
Jese (Real Madrid) dribbles into the box and fires the ball inside the right post. The goalkeeper had no chance. Sensational solo goal.

Adrian Colunga (Getafe) displays brilliant individual ability, gets inside the box and pulls the trigger. His promising effort is blocked by one of the defenders. The ball goes out for a corner. Getafe can continue in their attacking effort.
The foul by Gareth Bale (Real Madrid) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Pedro Perez Montero.
What an excellent finish! Karim Benzema (Real Madrid) latched on to an inch-perfect cross into the box and rifled an unstoppable low drive into the middle of the net and past the helpless goalkeeper.
Golden chance! Gareth Bale (Real Madrid) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post.
Juan Rodriguez (Getafe) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.

Gareth Bale (Real Madrid) is picked up by one of his teammates with a brilliant low pass, but he doesn't receive the ball well. The defence eliminates the danger without any problem. He could have found himself in a good chance to score.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Adrian Colunga (Getafe) misses a sitter from inside the six-yard box after striking the ball towards goal and it goes narrowly wide of the right post.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Karim Benzema (Real Madrid).
The referee gives a yellow card to Alexis (Getafe).
The manager has decided to substitute Adrian Colunga (Getafe) and he has been replaced by Angel Lafita (Getafe).
It will be a substitution. Mehdi Lacen (Getafe) is ready to enter the pitch as Borja walks off.
Luka Modric (Real Madrid) latches on to a pass and controls it with a good first touch. He unleashes a deadly strike from around 21 metres out which goes into the bottom right corner.
Juan Valera (Getafe) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Pablo Sarabia (Getafe) is coming onto the pitch as Pedro Leon cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Karim Benzema goes off the pitch and Isco (Real Madrid) comes on.
The referee Pedro Perez Montero awards Luka Modric (Real Madrid) a yellow card.
Booking. Angel Di Maria (Real Madrid) receives a caution from the referee.
Asier Illarramendi (Real Madrid) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Luka Modric.

Pepe (Real Madrid) wins himself just enough space to meet the resulting corner and shoots towards the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper makes a great save and gets the ball under control. Real Madrid have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
The referee signals a substitution. Casemiro (Real Madrid) is brought on as a substitute for Angel Di Maria.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Nono (Betis) makes a bad challenge and receives a yellow card. The referee had no doubt.

Jorge Molina (Betis) creates himself some space inside the goalmouth and connects with the resulting free kick. His header would have probably ended up low in the middle of the goal, but Roberto Fernandez pulls off a superb reflex save to thwart him.
Antonio Amaya (Betis) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case. Granada CF earn a free kick.

Youseff El Arabi (Granada CF) clutches his head in despair after blowing a huge opportunity! He receives the ball after the free kick and takes good first touch to unleash a low shot from close range, but Antonio Adan makes a nice save.
Allan Nyom (Granada CF) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee.
It's in the back of the net! Tiago Ilori plays it into the box, and Piti (Granada CF) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the bottom left corner. 1:0.
Piti (Granada CF) receives a yellow card.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Piti will be replaced by Dani Benitez (Granada CF).
That will be all from Lorenzo Reyes who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Salva Sevilla (Betis).
Substitution. Juan Carlos makes way for Leo Baptistao (Betis).

Dani Benitez (Granada CF) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the left post. The ball crosses the byline and it's going to be a goal kick.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nosa Igiebor (Betis) comes onto the pitch for Joan Verdu.
Roberto Fernandez (Granada CF) picks up a caution.
Dani Benitez (Granada CF) must think that he is playing a different sport because his behaviour has nothing to do with football and the referee has no choice but to show him a straight red card!
Youseff El Arabi will be replaced by Riki (Granada CF).
Leo Baptistao (Betis) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Here comes a substitution. Dimitri Foulquier (Granada CF) is brought on as a substitute for Yacine Brahimi.
Alfred John Momar N'Diaye (Betis) is shown a yellow card after a horrible tackle.
Riki (Granada CF) picks up a yellow card.
Antonio Amaya (Betis) won't see the end of today's match as two yellow cards inevitably means a red and the game is over for him.
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.
Bojan Jokic (Villarreal) is shown a yellow card for a late challenge.
Gustavo Daniel Cabral (Celta Vigo) receives a yellow card for infringement.
Yellow card. Jon Aurtenetxe (Celta Vigo) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge. Villarreal are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
A substitution has been made. Gustavo Daniel Cabral is replaced by Inigo Lopez (Celta Vigo).
David Fernandez Borbalan blows his whistle and the second half starts.

Giovani dos Santos (Villarreal) takes the corner. Bruno (Villarreal) connects with the corner kick around the penalty spot, but steers his header inches over the bar. The ball goes out of play. It's a goal kick.
The manager has decided to substitute Michael Krohn-Dehli (Celta Vigo) and he has been replaced by Duran Nolito (Celta Vigo).
David Fernandez Borbalan shows a yellow card to Augusto Fernandez (Celta Vigo) for a tough tackle.
What an amazing save by Juan Carlos! Santi Mina (Celta Vigo) swirls around the defenders and attempts to beat the keeper with a close-range shot towards the bottom left corner, but fails.

Moi Gomez (Villarreal) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the bottom right corner, but Yoel pulls off an exquisite save to deny him. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Villarreal will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Mateo Musacchio (Villarreal) sees a yellow card from David Fernandez Borbalan after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Here comes a substitution. Augusto Fernandez (Celta Vigo) has had enough and is replaced by Alex Lopez (Celta Vigo).
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Manuel Trigueros as he is replaced by Nahuel Leiva (Villarreal).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Gabriel (Villarreal) replaces Jose Antonio Dorado.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Giovani dos Santos walks off the pitch to be replaced by Jonathan Pereira (Villarreal).

Goal! Fabian Orellana (Celta Vigo) peels away from his marker to meet the resulting free kick from Alex Lopez, and he steers a powerful header from near the penalty spot low inside the right post. What a finish that is - 0:1!

Nolito (Celta Vigo) struck with a perfectly taken free kick from the edge of the box. He curled the ball straight inside the left post. There are not enough superlatives that can be used to describe that goal.
Nolito (Celta Vigo) is shown a yellow card by the referee.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
What a beauty from just outside the box! Adriano (Barcelona) lashed the ball with incredible pace and power into the bottom right corner.
Post! Lionel Messi (Barcelona) latches on to a sweet pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which only hits the right post. What an unlucky moment for him. It's a goal kick.

OFF THE POST! Pedro (Barcelona) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.

Iago Falque (Rayo Vallecano) picks up the rebound after chaos in the box and directs a low drive towards the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper, however, denies him with a stunning save. Rayo Vallecano have been awarded a corner kick.

Ruben hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Lionel Messi (Barcelona) shoots from the edge of the box towards the top right corner, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save. The ball goes behind for a corner. Barcelona will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.

Nice individual effort by Lionel Messi (Barcelona). He gets all the way through to the keeper and hits a low drive to the bottom right corner, but Ruben does a good job to anticipate the direction of the ball and keeps it out. The referee signals a corner kick to Barcelona.
Goal! That was a fantastic finish by Lionel Messi (Barcelona) from just outside the box. He wasted little time in getting away a bullet of a shot that flew past the goalkeeper.
Substitution. Tito (Rayo Vallecano) has come on for Anaitz Arbilla.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Juan Martinez Munuera blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Goal! Lionel Messi slips it to Alexis Sanchez (Barcelona) on the edge of the box and he finds the bottom right corner with a great effort. The score is 3:0.

Superb touch by Joaquin Larrivey (Rayo Vallecano) as he receives a precise pass inside the box. He finds the keeper prepared as he unleashes his shot to the left side of the goal. Wonderful save! It will be a corner kick for Rayo Vallecano.
Goal! Cesc Fabregas plays a pass to the feet of Pedro (Barcelona) and he shoots low into the back of the net from inside the box. It's 4:0.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Bueno as he is replaced by Jonathan Viera (Rayo Vallecano).
Pedro will be replaced by Neymar (Barcelona).

Lionel Messi (Barcelona) decides to keep the ball to himself and weaves through the defence into the box. From there he takes a shot which goes narrowly wide of the target. The play will restart with a goal kick.
Dani Alves (Barcelona) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the left post. A short break for the players as the play will restart with a goal kick.
Goal! Alexis Sanchez displays great vision and sends a pass to Lionel Messi (Barcelona), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom left corner. The score is 5:0.
That's the end of the game for Carles Puyol, who is replaced by Javier Mascherano (Barcelona).
Substitution. Joaquin Larrivey leaves the pitch and is replaced by Samuele Longo (Rayo Vallecano).
Substitution. Lionel Messi is replaced by Cristian Tello (Barcelona).

Cesc Fabregas (Barcelona) connects with an accurate pass inside the box and fires the ball to the bottom right corner, but one of the defending players steps in to block the effort. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Barcelona.
Adriano (Barcelona) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just over the crossbar. A brief respite for the players as it's a goal kick.
Goal! Neymar (Barcelona) hits the ball with great precision and it goes straight into the top left corner of the goal.
That's it for today, Juan Martinez Munuera has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Referee Carlos Velasco blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.
Today's referee Carlos Velasco rightly decides to book David Navarro (Levante) for his harsh tackle.

What a chance that is! Jonathan Zongo (Almeria) displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross, but he sends his header just over the crossbar. The ball goes to play from a goal kick.

David Barral (Levante) sends in a shot from a promising distance after a precise pass. His effort goes inches over the crossbar. None of the defensive players touched the ball. It's going to be a goal kick.
Carlos Velasco shows a yellow card to Sebastian Dubarbier (Almeria) for his blatant foul.
Ramon Azeez (Almeria) is booked. Levante have a free kick.
executes a nice mid-range free kick. His effort only flies inches wide of the left post. Today is obviously not his lucky day. It is going to be a goal kick.

David Barral (Levante) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom right corner. Esteban guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. The referee blows his whistle, Levante are awarded a corner kick.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Angel Trujillo (Almeria) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Carlos Velasco ignores the protests.
Here comes a substitution. Tired Victor Casadesus (Levante) left the pitch, and Papa Babacar Diawara (Levante) is coming on to help his team.

Aleix Vidal (Almeria) weaves through the defence with ease and gets into a good position in front of goal. He pulls the trigger in an effort to beat the keeper, but fails as the ball zooms around the left post. The play will restart with a goal kick.

The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Marcos Tebar Ramiro (Almeria) is coming onto the pitch as Sebastian Dubarbier cannot continue after picking up an injury.

Keylor Navas can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Oscar Diaz (Almeria). The ball would have probably ended up in the top left corner. Almeria will have a chance to score from a corner kick.

Raul Garcia (Atl. Madrid) scores! He latches on to a pass and produces a perfect strike from the edge of the box. The ball goes into the bottom right corner and past the goalkeeper.

What a great chance for Diego Godin (Atl. Madrid). He times his jump superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross from the corner, directing his towering header towards the foot of the right post, but the goalkeeper denies him with a miraculous save. Diego Godin (Atl. Madrid) jumped highest inside the box to meet a perfectly executed corner kick by Diego. His header was precise and ended up inside the right post, leaving the goalkeeper flapping in the wind. The score is 3:0.

Oriol Riera (Osasuna) looks very eager to impress, does well to beat his man and force a cross into the box, where one of his teammates gets his head on the ball, but it's too easy for the keeper. (in this sentence the player crosses and heads his own cross!! So I created a different scenario).

The referee points to the corner flag and Osasuna will take a corner. Lolo (Osasuna) rises highest from the corner to head at goal, but his low effort towards the middle of the goal is comfortably saved by the goalkeeper.

The game has begun to heat up. Jordan Loties (Osasuna) challenges an opponent and receives a deserved yellow card for his ugly tackle. A mid-range free kick is awarded to Elche out wide and from this angle a cross into the box is likely.

Alvaro Cejudo (Osasuna) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the middle of the target that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance.

Carlos Sanchez (Elche) meets a cross inside the box, but he is unable to produce an accurate header and it goes just over the bar. A short break for the players as the play will restart with a goal kick.

Yellow card. Damia (Osasuna) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.

Alejandro Arribas (Osasuna) commits an ugly challenge. The referee sees it and immediately blows his whistle. The referee points to the penalty spot. Elche are awarded a penalty kick!
Coro (Elche) misses the penalty! His poor effort goes well over the crossbar.

Santi Mina (Celta Vigo) latches on to a precise cross on the edge of the box and strikes the ball goalwards. However, it whistles wide of the left post so the goalkeeper can relax. The ball crosses the byline and it's going to be a goal kick.

Superb touch by Rafinha (Celta Vigo) as he receives a precise pass into the box, but the goalkeeper stops the ball as it heads towards the top left corner. Brilliant save! Celta Vigo will take a corner kick.

Charles (Celta Vigo) accepts a sweet pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a shot towards the goal, but he only hits the left post! What an unlucky moment for him.

Alberto Moreno (Sevilla) displayed his individual skill to score with a fantastic first-time shot from about 17 metres out. Victor Valdes was helpless and couldn't reach the ball which end up in the middle of the goal. Wonderful finish!

Carlos Bacca (Sevilla) shows good awareness inside the box as he latches on to a cross from the resulting free kick. He jumps high but his towering header lacks a little bit of accuracy and glances off the left-hand post.

Antoine Griezmann (Real Sociedad) creates himself some space around the penalty spot and connects with the free kick. His accurate header would have probably ended up inside the left post, but Keylor Navas pulls off a comfortable save to thwart him.

has issued a yellow card to Andreas Ivanschitz (Levante).

What was Roberto Lago (Getafe) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card. Osasuna are given an advantage. They have a free kick.

The manager makes a subsitution with Helder Barbosa (Almeria) coming on for Suso.
Patrick Ebert (Valladolid) is being dismissed by the referee, after receiving two yellow cards, followed by a red.
Valdet Rama (Valladolid) displays brilliant individual ability, gets inside the box and pulls the trigger. His promising effort is blocked by one of the defenders.
Substitution. Oscar Diaz (Almeria) in, Rodri out.
Carlos Pena (Valladolid) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Esteban (Almeria) is awarded a yellow card.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

The game is interrupted.  Damia (Osasuna) has violated the rules in the battle for the ball. No protests or gestures are being made as he is quite aware of what he did. Real Sociedad are awarded a free kick on the edge of the box.
Iñigo Martinez (Real Sociedad) rises above the defence to meet a cross from the corner. He has a good timing, but he directs his header just a few inches wide of the left post.
Antoine Griezmann (Real Sociedad) argues with the referee and receives a yellow card for dissent.

The ball from the free kick finds its way to Ion Ansotegi (Real Sociedad) who finds himself some space and scores with a thunderous header into the bottom right corner. An incredible long-range header!
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Carlos Del Cerro blows his whistle to start the second half.
Inigo Martinez (Real Sociedad) scores from the resulting corner! He rises highest and plants a powerful header beyond the goalkeeper into the roof of the net.
Jordan Loties (Osasuna) cannot believe that he has been told to leave the field of play after the referee blows his whistle and sends him off!
Osasuna have been awarded a free kick just outside the penalty area, in a dangerous position.
The substitute is ready due to the red card. Miguel Flano (Osasuna) comes on to replace Alvaro Cejudo.
Gorka Elustondo (Real Sociedad) picks up a yellow card.
Antoine Griezmann (Real Sociedad) gets on the end of the resulting corner and heads home. His perfect header goes into the roof of the net with majestic precision.
Chory Castro (Real Sociedad) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Chory Castro (Real Sociedad) spurned a good chance! He gets a shot away from inside the penalty box, but it goes inches wide of the right post.
Substitution. Francisco Punal (Osasuna) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Alejandro Arribas walks off.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and David Zurutuza trots off the pitch and is replaced by Xabi Prieto (Real Sociedad).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Imanol Agirretxe (Real Sociedad) comes onto the pitch for Antoine Griezmann.
That's the end of the game for Carlos Vela, who is replaced by Haris Seferovic (Real Sociedad).
That will be all from Oriol Riera who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Manuel Onwu (Osasuna).
Chory Castro (Real Sociedad) received a delightful pass inside the box before slotting the ball past the goalkeeper. What a brilliant finish!
Haris Seferovic (Real Sociedad) receives a killer pass and scores a great goal after finding the back of the net with a simple finish!
Carlos Del Cerro is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.

Alexis Sanchez (Barcelona) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Francisco Casilla guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Lionel Messi (Barcelona) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players.

What a wasted opportunity by David Lopez (Espanyol)! He unleashed a powerful low shot from the centre of the box, but Victor Valdes makes a decent save to thwart him. Espanyol have been awarded a corner kick.
Dani Alves (Barcelona) accepts a sweet pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a shot towards the goal, but he only hits the left post! What an unlucky moment for him.
Carlos Velasco shows a yellow card to Juan Rafael Fuentes (Espanyol) for a tough tackle.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Carlos Velasco blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Francisco Casilla pulls off a fantastic save! Lionel Messi (Barcelona) attempts to head home after a precise cross into the box. He aims his header towards the left post, but the effort is kept out.
Neymar (Barcelona) finds himself with a great opportunity! He unleashes a shot from the edge of the box, which whizzes just wide of the right post!
Thievy Bifouma (Espanyol) is leaving the pitch due to injury. John Cordoba (Espanyol) will take his place on the pitch.
Victor Sanchez (Espanyol) has received a yellow card for his foul.

Wonderful movement! Neymar (Barcelona) was in a good position inside the box, but he decides to pass the ball onto Alexis Sanchez (Barcelona) who keeps his cool and blasts the ball past the goalkeeper. What a finish that is – 1:0.
Yellow card. Javier Mascherano (Barcelona) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.
Sergio Garcia (Espanyol) blew a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross deep inside the box, but his shot flew just over the bar.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Alexis Sanchez walks off the pitch to be replaced by Pedro (Barcelona).
Substitution. Abraham did his best and is replaced by Manuel Lanzarote (Espanyol).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Cesc Fabregas (Barcelona) replaces Andres Iniesta.
Substitution. Marc Bartra (Barcelona) replaces Javier Mascherano.
Carlos Velasco shows a yellow card to Manuel Lanzarote (Espanyol), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
That's all for today as the game is over.
